guides.title: Cannot reactivate - Decommissioned at other location

steps.description:
This pack was decommissioned at another location and can only be reactivated at that location.

Are you aware whether this pack has been decommissioned on your behalf by the wholesaler or pharmacy you received it from?

steps.questionTitle: Packs that have been supplied in one location may only be reactivated in the same location.
steps.description: If you tried to reactivate the pack due to a procedural error, please document the root cause of the alert in NMVS Alerts. Once documented, the investigation is complete and the pack may be returned to saleable stock.

If the pack was decommissioned at the location you borrowed it from, you cannot reactivate it. If possible, ask the location you borrowed it from to reactivate it, but that can only be done within 10 days of the pack getting decommissioned. If you are certain that the pack was previously decommissioned at another location due to a procedural error, please document the root cause of the alert in NMVS Alerts. Once documented, the investigation is complete and the pack may be returned to saleable stock.
Please set this pack aside and contact SMVS-GmbH for assistance.

steps.questionTitle: This pack has already been decommissioned.
steps.description: Set the pack aside and contact SMVS GmbH for help with this alert. SMVS GmbH will need to run a pack audit trail for this pack to check the history of the pack because this is an uncommon alert.

guides.title: #A3 The batch is recognised by the SMVS but this serial number was not found in the system at the time of the scan.

steps.questionTitle: Check for manual data entry issue (procedural error)
steps.description:
[Link text Here](https://link-url-here.org)
- Bacon
- Ham
- Eggs 
1. TEST
2. st The most common procedural error that may have caused this is wrong manual entry.

Have you entered the data manually?

Check that the entered data matches what is printed on the package. Retype it carefully and verify the input.

Is the pack successfully verified?

Once the verification scan has resulted in a successful verification, the pack can be returned to saleable stock.

If your Point of Sales (POS) software told you that ‚Äòan alert has been raised‚Äô, please document the root cause of the alert in NMVS Alerts. Once documented the investigation is complete.

Alerts that are widely known may already have an investigation underway to determine the root cause. Check the current status of the NMVS Alerts investigation. 

Has the root cause been identified by SMVS or MAH?

A verification scan of the pack should be undertaken to determine if the corrective action has been successful. 

If the verification scan is successful, the pack may be returned to saleable stock.

Locate a package where the human-readable text (such as the product name or batch number) is clearly visible. 

Open any text editor on your computer and ensure you can type characters from your keyboard, which confirms your keyboard input is functioning correctly. 

Next, scan the package‚Äôs code and compare the scanned output in Notepad to the human-readable text you see on the package.

Does the scanned output not match the human-readable text on the package?

options.label: Human readable text is not visible

steps.description:
A verification scan of the pack should be undertaken to determine if the corrective action has been successful. 

If the verification scan is successful, the pack may be returned to saleable stock. If your Point of Sales (POS) software told you that ‚Äòan alert has been raised‚Äô, please document the root cause of the alert in NMVS Alerts. 

Once documented the investigation is complete.

If the human readable text is not clearly visible, open the provided link and review the sheet containing the data-matrix codes with their sample outputs. 

Open any text editor on your computer and verify that you can type characters from your keyboard. Use your scanner to scan one of the visible data-matrix codes from the sheet and then compare the scanned output to the sample output listed on the sheet.

Does the sample output differ from the one shown on the sheet?

You may use the NMVS-EVA (NMVS Backup System) to manually perform the desired action to maintain continuity in your work.

If successful it is advisable to fix the POS issue as soon as possible!

Where you able to perform the action manually?
If a root cause is still unknown at this stage, the package must continue to be withheld from saleable stock while you await feedback from the MAH.
